intro: Dipterocalyx scaberrimus, commonly known as the roughleaf flame tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bignoniaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters during the wet season. Its leaves are typically rough and hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in warm climates.
